channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Fentanyl Vaccine Is About to Get Its First Major Test
item.description: ARMR Sciences of New York is trialing a vaccine in the Netherlands to protect against fentanyl-related overdose and death.

item.title: Amazon Fire TV’s new AI feature lets you jump to scenes by describing them to Alexa+
item.description: Amazon says you can describe the scene to Alexa by mentioning details like the actor or character's name, or a memorable quote.

item.title: Spotify Wrapped 2025 adds its first multiplayer feature with ‘Wrapped Party’
item.description: Spotify Wrapped returns to its data-driven roots with new interactive features, deeper insights, and social experiences designed to revive its fan-fav...

item.title: 30% VistaPrint Coupon & Promo Codes | December 2025
item.description: From personalized gifts to business essentials, WIRED can help you save with our selection of VistaPrint promo codes.

item.title: Waymo starts autonomous testing in Philadelphia
item.description: Baltimore, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, and St. Louis join a long list of cities where the company is gearing up to offer robotaxi rides.

item.title: 4 Best Smart Displays (2025): Tested By a Smart Home Addict
item.description: Looking for a smart speaker that can do more than just talk back to you? These smart displays can stream your favorite shows, join a video call, and e...

item.title: Want a Fortell Hearing Aid? Well, Who Do You Know?
item.description: AI-powered startup Fortell has become a secret handshake for the privileged hearing-impaired crowd who swear by the product. Now, it wants to be in yo...

item.title: The Trump Administration Wants Immigrants to Self-Deport. It’s a Shit Show
item.description: The Trump administration has been virtually begging immigrants in the US to self-deport, even offering money. But some immigrants say it’s been nearly...

item.title: Google Photos’ 2025 Recap turns to Gemini to find your highlights
item.description: The Google Photos Recap will use Gemini's AI to find your memorable moments throughout the year, and adds new metrics, like a 'selfie' count.

item.title: Autolane is building ‘air traffic control’ for autonomous vehicles
item.description: And the Palo Alto-based startup has raised $7.4 million to do that.
